required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Articaine Computer-controlled and Conventional Delivery for Anterior and Middle Superior Alveolar Nerve Block for Tooth Extraction
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Anterior and Middle Superior Alveolar (AMSA) Nerve Block Anesthesia Obtained by Articaine Computer-controlled and Conventional Delivery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to investigate and compare pulpal anesthesia and cardiovascular parameters obtained with 0.6 ml of 4% articaine with epinephrine (1:100.000) for anterior and middle superior alveolar nerve (AMSA) block performed by standard and computer-controlled delivery for maxillary teeth extraction.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Measured by pulp sensitivity to electrical pulp tester

arm_group.arm_group_label: Computer controlled 4% articaine delivery by Anaeject
Conventional 4% articaine delivery by carpule syringe

intervention.intervention_name: Computer controlled 4% articaine delivery by Anaeject
intervention.description: Single dose of 0.6ml 4% articaine with epinephrine (1:100.000) delivered by computer controlled local anesthetic delivery system (Anaeject)
intervention.arm_group_label: Computer controlled 4% articaine delivery by Anaeject

intervention.intervention_name: Conventional 4% articaine delivery by carpule syringe
intervention.description: Single dose of 0.6ml 4% articaine with epinephrine (1:100.000) delivered by conventional syringe (carpule syringe).
intervention.arm_group_label: Conventional 4% articaine delivery by carpule syringe

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA 1
- maxillary incisors canines or premolars indicated for extraction due to periapical pathology, root fracture or orthodontic treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- allergies to local anesthetic solution ingredients, food and drugs
- alcohol and drugs abuse
- heavy tobacco smoking
